\subsection*{API CHANGE 2.0 : }

List of the scheduled changes for the GFal 2.0 API

\subsubsection*{I. BRIEF OF THE CHANGES : }

\begin{itemize}
\item POSIX API is still unchanged\end{itemize}


\begin{itemize}
\item Old non-POSIX functions do not exist anymore, most of them are converted to a POSIX one ( ex : gfal\_\-ls -$>$ gfal\_\-opendir, gfal\_\-readdir; gfal\_\-turlsfromsurls -$>$ gfal\_\-getxattr )\end{itemize}


\begin{itemize}
\item SRM related API is now in the gfal\_\-plugin\_\-lib. All the generic use case of the SRM API can be done with the POSIX API.\end{itemize}


\begin{itemize}
\item The old confusing error system disappear for a new GError system : \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-check\_\-error}{p.}{group__posix__group_g57ced6eae7afd2d0413988da02fe0373} , \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-print\_\-error}{p.}{group__posix__group_g03fcc29bc5d79dc2f65010846b0db024}, \doxyref{gfal\_\-posix\_\-strerror\_\-r}{p.}{group__posix__group_g2a9e2951c934dd1c3205a89c0d25ac29}\end{itemize}


\begin{itemize}
\item LRC/EDG legacy support is dropped.\end{itemize}


\begin{itemize}
\item Lots of the old dependencies are no more needed and are removed ( globus, gsoap, ccheck )\end{itemize}


\begin{itemize}
\item gfal works now with a plugin's architecture, it is easy to add/remove a plugin for a specific URL type with the env var GFAL\_\-PLUGIN\_\-LIST ( ex : GFAL\_\-PLUGIN\_\-LIST=libgfal\_\-plugin\_\-lfc.so:libgfal\_\-plugin\_\-srm.so:libgfal\_\-plugin\_\-rfio.so )\end{itemize}


\subsubsection*{III. ANOTHER DOCS : }

\begin{itemize}
\item More informations about the GError system : \tt{http://developer.gnome.org/glib/stable/glib-Error-Reporting.html}\item More informations about scons : \tt{http://www.scons.org/} \end{itemize}
